intro: Doellia bovei, commonly known as the Bove's doellia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and prominent stamens. Doellia bovei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
